page.title: 01Orby Village
page.content: Ory village betwen Wolds and Sea is an agricultural community with 6 farms, rangin from 40 to 300 acres, producing sheep, cattle, cereals and potatoes. There is considerable grass land, some woodland, smallish flat fields. Near to the village is a large grain store, and a motor race stadium. Most old houses, and new bungalows also church, chapel and public house are beside the long winding road. The school is closed. Employment is almost non-existant. Most newcomers are retired. A glass engraver, electrician, artist, tarmac layer,vet small holdes, and farm produce retailers are self-employed. The post office ofers a restricted service mains electricity is available, but no gas, main drain, or shop. Manor house farm, a listed building stands between the old moat and church.
